decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to aggressively rush down opponents with a combination of efficient creatures like Dusk Legion Zealot and Bloodtithe Harvester, backed up by disruption from Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The deck also has a strong vampire tribal theme, utilizing cards like Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet and Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord to bolster its board presence and gain incremental advantage. The deck aims to close out games quickly by overwhelming opponents with a mix of threats and removal spells.

The main concept of the deck is to utilize fast, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Burning-Tree Emissary along with powerful spells like Atarka's Command and Play with Fire to quickly deal damage to the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to stabilize. The deck also includes cards like Cunning Coyote and Kumano Faces Kakkazan to give additional versatility and ways to push through damage. The mana base is streamlined to ensure the deck can consistently hit its aggressive curve and apply pressure early in the game.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to quickly pressure the opponent and deal damage efficiently. By combining cards like Ensoul Artifact and Shrapnel Blast with powerful artifact creatures like Smuggler's Copter and Spyglass Siren, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick, aggressive plays. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency and versatility to the deck, allowing for additional resources to be utilized in the pursuit of victory. With a mix of removal and disruption spells, the deck looks to outpace opponents and secure a swift win.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Vein Ripper. The deck utilizes powerful threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to close out games quickly. The inclusion of cards like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord and Fatal Push helps to maintain board presence and remove opposing threats. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption to secure victories.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes using cards like Consider, Opt, and Treasure Cruise. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster help with this strategy. Additionally, the deck includes interaction with cards like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to control the board. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion providing additional mana. The goal is to bring back multiple Arclight Phoenixes to apply constant pressure on the opponent and close out the game quickly with aggressive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using cheap creatures and instant spells that boost their power. By utilizing cards like Titan's Strength, Audacity, and Monstrous Rage, along with efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cacophony Scamp, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early on and finish them off with direct damage spells like Thud and Kumano Faces Kakkazan. The land base is optimized for consistent mana production to support the aggressive game plan.

The primary idea behind this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy and hand, while also taking advantage of resources from discarded cards and generating card advantage. The deck focuses on using cards like Thoughtseize, Duress, Go Blank, and Liliana of the Veil to control the game, while cards like Waste Not and Reckoner Bankbuster provide additional value from discarding cards. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse serves as a powerful finisher, supported by removal spells like Fatal Push and Field of Ruin to maintain board control. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through efficient removal and resource manipulation.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly cast spells to trigger the graveyard recursion ability of Arclight Phoenix, allowing you to quickly bring it back to the battlefield. By utilizing card draw spells like Consider, Opt, and Sleight of Hand, along with removal spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe, you can control the board while setting up for explosive turns with Arclight Phoenix. The inclusion of Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder also helps disrupt your opponent's game plan, making it difficult for them to deal with your aggressive threats.

This UW Control deck focuses on maximizing card advantage and control through counterspells, removal, and card draw. The key strategy is to slowly grind out the opponent's resources while maintaining a steady stream of card advantage and eventually overwhelming them with powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck also includes utility lands and versatile removal spells to deal with a variety of threats, ensuring that the control player can handle any situation that arises.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost spells and cantrips to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes, allowing for fast and aggressive attacks. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion provides additional mana ramp and flexibility. Additional card draw and removal spells help maintain tempo and control the board, while the inclusion of Ledger Shredder and Proft's Eidetic Memory provide graveyard manipulation and recursion options. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells and resilient threats like Arclight Phoenix.
